page.title: 07Housing in Llangybi
page.content: The greater proportion of houses in Llangybi have been built in the last 20 years.There are two estates of privately owned houses numbering 50,28 large executive type houses(two completed in 1985),a council estate made up of 9 family houses and 28 bungalows for elderly people.There are a few terraced cottages on one side of the main road in the the heart of the village and several others near the centre once used to house farm workers Near the Church is a large house owned by the "squire".There is a modern rectory next to the victorian rectory, the latter now privately owned. Scattered about are several farmhouses which have been considerably improved and renovated; several former farmworkers cottages and the old school house are now occupied by the public as Llangybi Estate tenants.
